website_summaries.verdict: A value-priced yet rugged pair of hiking socks. The industry-leading manufacturer guarantee adds to their value.
pros: The socks keep feet dry and have exclusive antibacterial wool construction that also helps prevent blisters
cons: Some owners, especially those with smaller feet, say these socks run somewhat large

customer_reviews.title: Really comfortable and functional trail socks. The kind that you buy one pair and then another, and another...
customer_reviews.text: These are really comfortable and functional trail socks. The kind that you buy one pair and then another, and another, until you're only wearing these. Padded in the right spots, durable, breathable (but warm), dry quickly enough, and somehow seem to avoid most of the stink associated with sweaty feet living in hiking boots for several days. I own several other brands of wool socks, but that number is dwindling as these are far and away my favorite. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Grzymkowski

customer_reviews.title: Not a hiking sock
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a pair 4 years ago for hiking. They are my favorite sock. Thought I'd get another pair. These are no where the quality of those. They are very thin and contain a higher nylon content. Totally unsuitable for hiking. Don't be fooled by their description. Save your money. I wish I had.
customer_reviews.author: Ac4gators

customer_reviews.title: well fitting and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I think I like these better than smartwool socks. seem to fit better and dont bunch up under the foot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great quality, XXL is still too small
customer_reviews.text: wish these fit, because the quality and warranty is great. XXL are very long but tight around the ankle and heel- total deal breaker. Hoping Darn tough revises their sizing to be accurately scaled up instead of just longer.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Scrutiny

customer_reviews.title: No reason to buy anything else
customer_reviews.text: BEST SOCKS ON THE PLANET! Have work Darn Tough socks exclusively (as in I got rid of all my other socks) for two years...for hiking, cycling, yard work, errands, to the office, to weddings and funerals...in wet weather, dry weather, 20 below and 100 above...I see absolutely no reason to buy any other. None have worn out or are even close to wearing out. Comfortable and absolutely odor proof! Worth every penny and a testament to the craftspeople in Vermont who are making a go of manufacturing quality in the US!
customer_reviews.author: David G.

customer_reviews.title: Darn tough and darn honest!
customer_reviews.text: I own several pairs of darn tough socks. They are warm, comfortable, don't need to be washed after one wearing, and they are tough! I did have one sock wear through, sent the pair back with their warranty sheet and presto, a brand new pair appeared in the mail with no questions asked. Worth every penny to deal with a company with a great product and integrity.
customer_reviews.author: RSM

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Seem well made. Comfortable. Just wish they came a little higher up on the leg
customer_reviews.author: Boffmann

customer_reviews.title: Small to size, but good quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, but small to size. You don't know that until one puts them on. They need to make the sizes more accurate. If I ordered again, I would get a larger size
customer_reviews.author: ursustech

customer_reviews.title: A Great Pair of Socks
customer_reviews.text: When I saw these socks at REI for $20 I thought you have to be kidding, $20 for one pair of socks. On a lark with $20 in hand I decided to try them thinking this is really Dumb. Ok, So now I have 6 pairs, they are worth the money, the most comfortable socks I've worn, Ever.
customer_reviews.author: kris kistner

customer_reviews.title: they fit today like they did 2 years ago
customer_reviews.text: I've had these socks for about 2 years and wear them all the time. The durability is outstanding; they fit today like they did 2 years ago. Despite not being nearly as thick as other winter socks, these are surprisingly warm, probably the warmest in my drawer. I'm buying a few more pairs.
customer_reviews.author: thelaibon

customer_reviews.title: These are some darn tough socks, bought three pairs.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, these socks are darn tough and very comfortable. Plus a lifetime warranty, what could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Eggerts

customer_reviews.title: between these and good boots, no blisters over three days straight of ...
customer_reviews.text: couldn't ask more from a sock. so soft and comfy on my feet. between these and good boots, no blisters over three days straight of hiking. Does run slightly small but probably helpful to keep the feet from swelling by evening.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two pairs, they lasted three years of daily wear.
customer_reviews.author: Jason J. Fedelem

customer_reviews.title: Great for Hunting Boots!
customer_reviews.text: I fell in love with these socks. I intended to use them for my hunting boots and they are awesome! My feet stays dry with comfortable temp. It was warm in early October and my feet was not sweaty. Now its cold (U.P of Michigan) and my feet are warm. When I'm not hunting, I just wear them around the house or outside. If you're an outdoors man and wants to find good durable socks, this is it!
customer_reviews.author: DetroiterBecker

customer_reviews.title: Great Hiking Socks
customer_reviews.text: Wore these last weekend on a 5 hour AT hike with some boulder climbing tossed in. Even has some rain showers on us. Had zero issues with my feet. When I got home and took my boots off, my feet were completely dry. Will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Way too elastic.
customer_reviews.text: While the sizing is correct, the construction and materials quite good, the socks fit me as overly snug in the calf and the squeeze makes it something I can't wear too long. A better fit in this regard is the Thorlo brand.
customer_reviews.author: Manfish

customer_reviews.title: Your feet are worth it!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! Absolutely the perfect sock, with a lifetime guarantee. Only way it would be better is if they guaranteed lost socks, since missing one out of the dryer is the only way to destroy these.
customer_reviews.author: Lubbz

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer needs to revise sizing
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these merino wool socks for my boyfriend, and MY GOODNESS do they run small. Compared to a pair of same-sized EMS socks, they are three sizes smaller. He can barely get his foot into them. The sock looks nice, arrived on time and seems as if it'd be comfortable if the sizing was right, but that doesn't count for much if it can double as a Chinese foot-binding tool.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree C

customer_reviews.title: Too Darn Tough
customer_reviews.text: These socks didn't work for me. I read the other reviews and took a gamble. When I got mine they were so tough and rough. They did keep my feet warm, but they don't ventilate as well as my Wigwam socks. I tried to give these pair a second chance on a colder day, but it was just too rough for my feet. I'm sure these are tough socks and would be great for someone that can easily wear a hole through their socks. But I'm just looking for a nice warm pair of winter socks that can keep me warm on my long winter walks. So I settled on Wigwam Women's Merino Wool Cushioned Quarter Socks instead.
customer_reviews.author: Sunyee

customer_reviews.title: Too small, runs tight
customer_reviews.text: The sock color patterns are attractive and they have a good wool content. Unfortunately they are a bit scratchy. But what really bothers me is I can't wear them they're so tight! I ordered MEDIUM, and I wear a woman's size 6.5, but these are so tight! Too small. They have a problem with sizing.
customer_reviews.author: F.Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite socks
customer_reviews.text: These are very similar to Smartwool socks, which I love. I love these a little more. They fit well. They're incredibly comfortable--even more so than Smartwool, possibly because the knit seems to be just a tiny bit finer. And they were a little less expensive. Just about perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: bonsai bulldog

customer_reviews.title: too tight
customer_reviews.text: Those sock were really really tight, just trying on made my feet feel uncomfortable. I really hoped to get somethings nice based on reviews but unfortunately i had to send the socks back. very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: dont waste yer money
customer_reviews.text: If you are a size 12 wide..these wont fit you either...what they mean by extra large..I have no idea...disappointed.... I knew the minute i saw them in the cheap stupid packaging...they wouldn't fit..
customer_reviews.author: Robert I. Bloom

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased for my nephew because my son love them and wears them all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Susie Q

product_meta.title: Darn Tough Hiker Micro Crew Cushion Sock - Men's
feature_bullets: MIDWEIGHT WITH CUSHION — A warm and extremely comfortable choice when conditions demand it, this fine gauge knitted sock provides mid-level cushion density under your foot. True Seamless technology allows for an undetectable seam fusion for an ultra-smooth, invisible feel.
MICRO CREW HEIGHT - A shorter, more concise take on the traditional crew height. Peeks just above the top of a standard hiking boot. See chart below if other heights may be better for you.

COMPOSITION - Designed and Knit in Vermont with 61% Merino Wool, 36% Nylon, 3% Lycra Spandex. The fast action wicking pulls moisture away from skin, so no more sweaty, stinky socks. The soft, breathable merino wool has fast drying, all weather performance that keeps you cool in the summer and warm in the winter.

GUARANTEED FOR LIFE - Darn Tough's famous guarantee - if these socks wear, tear, or develop holes, Darn Tough will replace them no questions asked. No strings. No conditions. Over the years, when you open your sock drawer this is the pair you’ll keep grabbing first. In fact, many customers have said that they “threw away just about every other sock” they owned.
MADE IN THE USA - Every pair of socks is knit in Northfield, Vermont - the perfect testing ground for the finest premium all weather performance socks.
